abstract: Seven police officers are killed when car bomb explodes in primarily Kurdish city of Diyarbakir, Turkey, day before scheduled visit by Prime Min Ahmet Davutoglu; Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan attributes attack to militants, whose resurgence since end of cease-fire between Turkish government and Kurdistan Workers’ Party has roiled country's southeast.
lead_paragraph: About two dozen people were wounded in the latest violence to hit the biggest city in the largely Kurdish region of southeastern Turkey.

headline.main: Car Bomb Kills 7 Turkish Police Officers in Diyarbakir
headline.print_headline: Car Bomb Kills 7 Police Officers and Injures Dozens of Civilians in Southeast Turkey

snippet: About two dozen people were wounded in the latest violence to hit the biggest city in the largely Kurdish region of southeastern Turkey.
